CVE-Description: An attacker was able to inject an event handler into a privileged object that would allow arbitrary JavaScript execution in the parent process. Note: This vulnerability affects Desktop Firefox only, it does not affect mobile versions of Firefox. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 124.0.1 and Firefox ESR < 115.9.1.
Title: Mozilla Firefox Multiple Vulnerabilities (MFSA2024-15)
Solution: Vendor has released fix to address these vulnerabilities. Upgrade to Firefox 124.0.1 to fix vulnerability, you can also refer MFSA2024-15 or later for more details.(https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/security/advisories/mfsa2024-15/)
Operating System: Microsoft Windows Server 2019 Datacenter 10.0.17763 64-bit N/A Build 17763 UBR 5696
Threat: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could lead to a security breach or could affect integrity, availability, and confidentiality.

CVE-Description: An attacker was able to perform an out-of-bounds read or write on a JavaScript object by fooling range-based bounds check elimination. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 124.0.1.
Title: Mozilla Firefox Multiple Vulnerabilities (MFSA2024-15)
Solution: Vendor has released fix to address these vulnerabilities. Upgrade to Firefox 124.0.1 to fix vulnerability, you can also refer MFSA2024-15 or later for more details.(https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/security/advisories/mfsa2024-15/)
Operating System: Microsoft Windows Server 2019 Datacenter 10.0.17763 64-bit N/A Build 17763 UBR 5696
Threat: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could lead to a security breach or could affect integrity, availability, and confidentiality.

Title: Microsoft .NET Core and ASP.NET Core Security Update for February 2024
Solution: Customers are advised to refer to CVE-2024-21404, CVE-2024-213866 for more information on the vulnerability and it's patch.(https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-21386)
Operating System: Microsoft Windows Server 2019 Datacenter 10.0.17763 64-bit N/A Build 17763 UBR 5696
Threat: Vulnerable versions of Microsoft .NET Core and ASP.NET Core are prone to Denial of Service vulnerability.

CVE-Description: .NET, .NET Framework, and Visual Studio Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
Title: Microsoft .NET Core and ASP.NET Core Security Update for November 2023
Solution: Customers are advised to refer to CVE-2023-36049, CVE-2023-36558, CVE-2023-36038 for more details pertaining to these vulnerabilities.(https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2023-36038)
RTI: Active Attacks,Denial Of Service,Easy Exploit,High Data Loss,High Lateral Movement,Malware Name,Remote Code Execution,Privilege Escalation
Operating System: Microsoft Windows Server 2019 Datacenter 10.0.17763 64-bit N/A Build 17763 UBR 5696
Threat: Vulnerable versions of Microsoft ASP.NET Core and .NET Core are prone to Elevation of Privilege, Security Feature Bypass and Denial of Service vulnerability.
